lg.l: To an Excellent new Tune.
PRay, what is this Bank of which the Town Rings
The Banks of a River I know are good Things
But a Pox o'those Banks that choak up the Springs,Some Mischief is Brewing, Project smells Rank,To shut out the River by raising the Bank.
The Dams and the Weirs must all be your own
You get all Fish, an others gets none,
We look for a Salmon, you leave us a StoneBut Thanks to the House, the P────ors look blank,And Thanks to those Members that Kickt down the Bank
This Bank it is to make us a new Paper-Mill
This Paper they say, by the help of a Quill
The whole Nations Pockets with Money will fillBut we doubt that our Purses will quickly grow lankIf nothing but Paper comes out of the Bank,
'Tis happy to see the whole Kingdom in Rags
For Rags will make Paper, and Pa-ba-ba-brags,
This Paper will soon make us richer than GragsFrom a bo-bo-bo-Boy he pursues his old HankAnd now he runs mad for a ba-ba-ba-Bank
Oh! then but see how the Beggars will Vapour,
For Beggars have Rags and Rags will make Paper,
And Paper makes Money, and what can be cheaper,Methinks I now see them so jovial and crankAll riding on Horseback to H---ll and the Bank.
But the Cobler was angry, and swore he had rather,
As they did in old Times, make Money of Leather,
